Service sites are listed below:

Bardstown Primary School
Meals can be picked up from the kitchen door at the back of the building. Directional signage will be posted.

Bardstown High School
Meals can be picked up at the kitchen door located next to the student parking lot. Directional signage will be posted.

In an effort to increase awareness of the 2020 Census, we held an art contest for students in grades K-5. Mayor Dick Heaton had the opportunity to review contest finalists and selected the art that he felt represented the census and our community the best. We would like to congratulate Bardstown Elementary School 4th grader, Annalisa Lawson for being chosen as the census art contest winner!
Please take the time to complete the census for your household. The census can be found at https://my2020census.gov/.

Per recommendation from Governor Beshear, Bardstown City Schools will not return for in-person instruction or activities the remainder of this school year. School districts have been given flexibility for calculating hours of instruction through NTI (non-traditional instruction), which could change our last day of school. The Bardstown City Schools Board of Education makes decisions regarding our school calendar. Currently, the Board of Education is reviewing their options to determine our last day of NTI for students and options to celebrate graduation for the Class of 2020. Final decisions will be made and communicated very soon.

I want to thank each and every member of our school community for your patience as we finish out this school year remotely. Your positive attitudes during this challenging time make me even more proud to be a Tiger.
